Class UserService

java.lang.Object
edu.tamu.csce331.sharetea.database.UserService
public class UserService extends Object
Service class for managing user-related database operations in the Sharetea POS system.

This service provides comprehensive functionality for user management, including authentication, user account management, and role-based access control. It handles the complete user lifecycle from creation to deletion, with integration to the role management system.

Key features include:

  • User authentication and validation
  • User account CRUD operations
  • Role-based access control integration
  • Comprehensive user information management
  • Employee directory functionality

The service handles multiple database tables:

  • users - Main user account records
  • roles - Role definitions and permissions

This service supports various user management scenarios:

  • Employee onboarding and account creation
  • User authentication for system access
  • Role assignment and permission management
  • User profile updates and maintenance
  • Employee directory and contact management
Since:
1.0

    • UserService

      public UserService()

  • Method Details

    • authenticateUser

      public User authenticateUser(String username)
      Authenticates a user by username and retrieves complete user information.

      This method performs user authentication by looking up the username in the database and returning the complete user profile including role information. The method joins the users and roles tables to provide comprehensive user data for authentication and authorization purposes.

      The returned User object includes:

      • User identification and contact information
      • Role ID and role name for permission checking
      • Account creation timestamp
      • Full name for display purposes

      This method is typically used during the login process to validate user credentials and establish user session information.

      Parameters:
      username - the username to authenticate (case-sensitive)
      Returns:
      a User object containing complete user information if the username is found, null if the username does not exist or if a database error occurs
      See Also:
      • for retrieving multiple users
      • for creating new user accounts

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves all users from the system with their role information.

      This method returns a comprehensive list of all users in the system, including their role information through a join with the roles table. Users are ordered alphabetically by full name for consistent presentation.

      This method is useful for:

      • Employee directory displays
      • Administrative user management
      • Generating user reports
      • Role assignment oversight
      Returns:
      a List of User objects containing all users in the system with their role information, ordered by full name. Returns an empty list if no users exist or if a database error occurs.
      See Also:
      • for individual user lookup
      • for creating new users

    • addUser

      public boolean addUser(User user)
      Creates a new user account in the system.

      This method adds a new user to the database with the provided information. The user account will be created with the specified role assignment and contact information. The system automatically assigns a unique user ID and creation timestamp.

      The new user account includes:

      • Unique username for login purposes
      • Full name for identification
      • Role assignment for permission management
      • Email address for communication
      • Automatic creation timestamp

      This method is typically used during employee onboarding to create new user accounts for system access.

      Parameters:
      user - the User object containing the user data to be created. Must not be null and should have valid username, full name, role ID, and email information.
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully created in the database, false if the operation failed (e.g., duplicate username)
      See Also:
      • for modifying existing users
      • for user validation

    • updateUser

      public boolean updateUser(User user)
      Updates an existing user account with new information.

      This method modifies the properties of an existing user account based on the provided User object. The update is performed using the user's ID to identify the correct record and can modify personal information and role assignments.

      Fields that can be updated include:

      • Full name for identification
      • Role assignment for permission changes
      • Email address for communication

      Note: The username cannot be updated through this method to maintain login consistency and prevent authentication issues.

      Parameters:
      user - the User object containing the updated data. Must not be null and must have a valid userId.
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully updated in the database, false if no rows were affected (user not found)
      See Also:
      • for creating new users
      • for retrieving user information

    • deleteUser

      public boolean deleteUser(Long userId)
      Deletes a user account from the system.

      This method permanently removes a user account from the database. The deletion is performed using the user's ID to identify the correct record. This operation should be used with caution as it may affect historical data and audit trails.

      Considerations for user deletion:

      • Historical order data may reference the deleted user
      • Audit trails and transaction logs may be affected
      • This operation cannot be easily undone

      This method is typically used for:

      • Removing terminated employee accounts
      • Cleaning up test or temporary accounts
      • Account maintenance and cleanup
      Parameters:
      userId - the unique identifier of the user to delete
      Returns:
      true if the user was successfully deleted from the database, false if the operation failed or no user was found
      See Also:
      • for modifying users instead of deleting
      • for reviewing users before deletion
